name: politico
text:
The Pentagon’s top military leaders are under quarantine. The president's case of #Covid is prompting concern that the U.S. is vulnerable to adversaries.

And the election is stoking fears of more unrest in America's cities https://t.co/s6a26jHVO3

name: politico
text:
Mike Pence has the toughest job in politics tonight: defending Donald Trump's pandemic response
https://t.co/22SEkvp4MU

name: politico
text: President Trump teased a complete withdrawal of U.S troops from Afghanistan by Christmas, an aggressive timeline to fulfill a campaign promise to end what he's called America’s “endless wars” that comes as he trails in polls a month before the election https://t.co/uJ6ZuB6PId

name: politico
text:
Mike Pence has a clear task tonight: Clean up everything his boss said during last week's debate.

And Kamala Harris' goal will be to tie Pence to the administration's failure to contain the virus.
Join our #VPDebate live chat for more hot takes tonight: 
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text: An explosive rise of Covid-19 cases in Wisconsin is worsening, overwhelming health services and especially hitting hard the northeastern region, putting in peril Donald Trump’s ability to win this key battleground state https://t.co/QBcWQIPIDO

name: politico
text: The University of Utah is hosting the first and only debate between Vice President Mike Pence and Sen. Kamala Harris https://t.co/axtpaFaPcZ

name: politico
text:
Not only should the #VPDebate be more “normal” than last week’s, but it also might be far more skillful. Both Mike Pence and Kamala Harris are arguably better traditional debaters than the presidential candidates, says @hollyotterbein

More live analysis:
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text:
Kamala Harris is employing the same tactic Joe Biden did last week by speaking directly to the camera and the viewer instead of just addressing the moderator, notes @nancook.

More #VPDebate live analysis:
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text: Opinion: If the existence of the country itself is on the ballot in November, why not prepare better for the debates? https://t.co/kFJffdssLq

name: politico
text: Kamala Harris said on the #VPDebate stage tonight that she’d take a coronavirus vaccine if scientists said yes, but wouldn’t if Trump said to take it https://t.co/kmGYfa3Dz6 https://t.co/TZDo19CbFC

name: politico
text:
The Trump campaign has repeatedly accused Harris of sowing doubt about the safety of a vaccine if it is developed and approved while Trump is still in office.

More #VPDebate live analysis: https://t.co/kmGYfa3Dz6 https://t.co/qNJW84YmiC

name: politico
text: Trump’s tweet storm was not just seen as “Trump being Trump.” It caused some, including House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, to wonder whether the steroids Trump took as part of his coronavirus treatment were fueling his all-caps tweetfest https://t.co/MooTrMdMzh

name: politico
text: RT @BresPolitico: Pence gets asked a climate change question, talks about taxes and fracking. Asked about health care, Pence talks about fracking

name: politico
text: Kamala Harris came out swinging against the Trump White House from the first moments of the debate, calling the administration’s handling of the Covid-19 pandemic “the greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country" https://t.co/AW1TFiwRSi

name: politico
text:
In 2016, the Trump campaign argued that Democrats made America lose respect on the world stage. Tonight, Harris is arguing that the Trump administration made America lose respect on the world stage, notes @hollyotterbein.

#VPDebate live analysis: 
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and his chief election official said the state has no reason to extend a voter registration deadline and that doing so would undermine the public’s faith in the upcoming presidential election https://t.co/ECjtlC5Jmw

name: politico
text:
Kamala Harris dodged Mike Pence’s repeated questions on court-packing. Expect the Trump campaign to invoke this repeatedly in coming days, says @GabbyOrr_ .

More #VPDebate live analysis:
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text:
It doesn’t seem sustainable that Biden and Harris will be able to avoid answering the court-packing question before Election Day. Maybe they will hunker down but the dodges are becoming more and more ridiculous, says @AlxThomp.

https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text: Kamala Harris sharply denounced the White House #covid response at the start of Wednesday's VP debate, repeatedly accusing the Trump administration of covering up the truth about the disease and ineptly addressing the pandemic https://t.co/xEm73oXH3Y

name: politico
text:
Mike Pence is going after Kamala Harris in the same way Donald Trump has gone after Joe Biden: trying to make the case at the same time that they’re both too soft on crime and tough on crime, notes @AliceOllstein.

More #VPDebate live analysis:
https://t.co/kHCGIqQeIO

name: politico
text: Mike Pence defended a Rose Garden event last month after which more than 30 people, including the president, tested positive for #Covid https://t.co/QMNcY25aQV

name: politico
text:
“Mr. Vice President, I'm speaking.”

– Kamala Harris shutting down Mike Pence on the #VPDebate stage 

Catch up with the key moments: https://t.co/GmYPN8plHm https://t.co/jv49QeMHZZ

name: politico
text: Pence honored Kayla Mueller, an American humanitarian worker who was captured and killed by members of the militant group ISIS https://t.co/AW1TFiwRSi

name: politico
text: While discussing Trump’s record in the Middle East, Pence pointed out that the DOJ extradited and charged men believed to be Islamic State fighters with offenses related to their alleged roles in the kidnapping of Americans, including Mueller in 2015 https://t.co/AW1TFiwRSi?

name: politico
text: Cal Cunningham reemerged Wednesday in an effort to jump start his embattled campaign for Senate in North Carolina, after revelations that the Democrat and Army reservist had an extramarital affair https://t.co/Xe6edqN02D

name: politico
text: An uninvited guest stole the spotlight for a portion Wednesday night's vice presidential debate: a fly that perched upon Vice President Mike Pence's hair https://t.co/Q2NWbiOgi5

name: politico
text: Mike Pence skirted a question during Wednesday's debate about whether President Donald Trump would accept the results of the election if he loses https://t.co/QOJZMKDOcC https://t.co/uKEKfC5ZLn

name: politico
text:
Mike Pence criticized the damage caused by rioting and looting this summer when asked about justice for Black Americans killed by police.

He also reiterated the Trump administration’s support for law enforcement https://t.co/7owdCAZKht https://t.co/C4TUORH25F

name: politico
text: While discussing Trump’s record in the Middle East, Mike Pence honored Kayla Mueller, an American humanitarian worker who was captured and killed by members of the militant group ISIS https://t.co/i1juVzSNkH https://t.co/jncfHLQJxi

name: politico
text:
Asked if he believes climate change is an “existential threat,” Pence turned to taxes, criticizing Biden for proposing to cancel Trump-era tax cuts.

He hit Harris and Biden on fracking and fossil fuels, saying a Biden admin would “crush” American jobs https://t.co/dBQEPhbWM1 https://t.co/bEJiL5JWcB

name: politico
text: Before the fireworks began between Mike Pence and Kamala Harris, attendees received a stern warning about keeping their masks on during the proceedings https://t.co/OnOeoizNNi https://t.co/lY8js9tZHY

name: politico
text: Trump’s dealings with China have led to a “manufacturing recession,” Harris said, noting that the U.S. lost 300,000 manufacturing jobs and that farmers have gone bankrupt because of the trade war https://t.co/VedxYd1FTQ https://t.co/lrXy1wQmwF

name: politico
text: Sen. Kamala Harris on Wednesday pointedly ducked several questions about whether a Biden-Harris administration would try to “pack” the Supreme Court to dilute what could become a solid conservative majority on the court https://t.co/qXMoosXPl9

name: politico
text:
Moderator Susan Page spent 90 minutes quizzing Vice President Mike Pence and Sen. Kamala Harris at Wednesday night's debate.

But while Pence and Harris spent a lot of time talking, they spent less time actually answering the questions Page asked  https://t.co/0neIoCz7Ls

name: politico
text: Just a week after Fox News' Chris Wallace got roasted for ceding control to Donald Trump and Joe Biden on the debate stage, USA Today’s Susan Page fared little better with the vice-presidential contenders https://t.co/f7mHd3GBdR

name: politico
text: Page repeatedly allowed Kamala Harris and Mike Pence to interrupt each other and her throughout the debate, letting them spar instead of answering the questions. She declined to pose follow-up questions, allowing them to avoid substantive inquiries https://t.co/f7mHd3GBdR

name: politico
text:
During the #VPDebate, Kamala Harris pointedly ducked several questions about whether a Biden-Harris administration would try to “pack” the Supreme Court. 

Joe Biden has done the same in the weeks since Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg died. https://t.co/09EMF1ouGM https://t.co/mBAeWvtZxs

name: politico
text:
Here's what we actually learned about Kamala Harris' and Mike Pence's policies from their #VPDebate.

Our takeaways on coronavirus, taxes, climate change, SCOTUS, abortion, racial justice and policing: https://t.co/MXC6HXIMzN

name: politico
text:
“Pence proved better at politics than his running mate.”

17 experts weigh in on the biggest moments from the #VPDebate:  https://t.co/w4uBn7IGlT

name: politico
text:
Kamala Harris came out swinging over the Trump administration's coronavirus response. Mike Pence demanded answers over whether a Biden administration would pack the Supreme Court. 

Catch up with the top moments from the first and only #VPDebate. 

https://t.co/EvenMDQg7y https://t.co/XcpMh9thyN

name: politico
text: Column: What was hailed as the most important vice presidential debate ever simply wasn’t, writes @harrispolitico  https://t.co/HRO867AgkU

name: politico
text: Harris slammed the Trump administration’s record on climate change during the #VPDebate Wednesday night, accusing the administration of being anti-science and failing to address the “existential threat” that climate change poses https://t.co/xQRWYiFzxe https://t.co/tF3Aln2Eou

name: politico
text: The #VPDebate was sort of how debates used to be: Professional politicians who are mostly civil to each other making their points, occasionally skirting the rules, and frequently spinning the facts, writes @RyanLizza  https://t.co/9yAzj9HZHW

name: politico
text: Mike Pence slammed Kamala Harris’ record as California AG during the #VPDebate Wednesday night, saying “you did nothing on criminal justice reform in California” https://t.co/WxxgmdwN6k https://t.co/VRFrS4qUxn

name: politico
text:
Harris sidestepped questions about court packing just as Joe Biden has done in the weeks since Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg died and President Trump vowed to confirm a replacement. 

Biden is on record before September as opposing packing the court
https://t.co/qXMoosXPl9

name: politico
text:
Susan Page neglected to ask follow-up questions on a number of topics during the #VPDebate, allowing both Mike Pence and Kamala Harris to easily avoid answering.

https://t.co/f7mHd3GBdR

name: politico
text: A wave of bad poll numbers continued crashing down on Trump yesterday. They fall into two buckets:  those that are bad for the president, and those that are horrible. https://t.co/RRM9NNyuYA

name: politico
text:
Race defined last week's combative presidential debate. 

During Wednesday’s vice presidential debate, it was merely a footnote. https://t.co/ngEj17ZTpq

name: politico
text: Millions of struggling voters — including in key swing states — will probably not see any more enhanced unemployment benefits or direct stimulus checks before the election https://t.co/kjl5MJz8uF

name: politico
text: President Donald Trump said this morning that he will not participate in a virtual debate against Joe Biden, essentially pulling out of next week’s town-hall style event https://t.co/pj4EdGnTGc

name: politico
text: JPMorgan Chase announced early this morning that it will commit an additional $30 billion over the next five years to providing economic opportunity to underserved communities https://t.co/9JQuh4GW2y
